action.action-desc: Ms. Norton introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Ways and Means

form.official-title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to provide a payroll tax exemption for hiring long-term unemployed individuals.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Reducing Long-Term Unemployment Act.

section.header: Payroll tax exemption for hiring long-term unemployed individuals

subsection.text: Paragraph (1) of section 3111(d) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by inserting or on the day after the date of the enactment of the Reducing Long-Term Unemployment Act and ending on December 31, 2018, after December 31, 2010,.

paragraph.text: Subparagraph (B) of section 3111(d)(3) of such Code is amended to read as follows:

subparagraph.text: certifies by signed affidavit (under penalties of perjury) that such individual, during the entire 27-week period ending on the hiring date—

clause.text: was in receipt of unemployment compensation under State or Federal law, or
was unemployed and would have been so in receipt but for having exhausted the right to such unemployment compensation during such period,

paragraph.text: Subsection (d) of section 3111 of such Code is amended by adding at the end the following new paragraph:
The aggregate reduction in tax imposed under subsection (a) by reason of paragraph (1) with respect to each qualified individual in the employer’s employ shall not exceed $5,000.

Paragraph (1) of section 3221(c) of such Code is amended by inserting or on the day after the date of the enactment of the Reducing Long-Term Unemployment Act and ending on December 31, 2018, after December 31, 2010,.

subparagraph.text: Subparagraph (B) of section 3221(c)(3) of such Code is amended to read as follows:
certifies by signed affidavit (under penalties of perjury) that such individual, during the entire 27-week period ending on the hiring date—

clause.text: was in receipt of unemployment compensation under State or Federal law, or
was unemployed and would have been so in receipt but for having exhausted the right to such unemployment compensation during such period,

paragraph.text: Subsection (c) of section 3221 of such Code is amended by adding at the end the following new paragraph:
The aggregate reduction in tax imposed under subsection (a) by reason of paragraph (1) with respect to each qualified individual in the employer’s employ shall not exceed $5,000.

subsection.header: Special rule for certain calendar quarters
subsection.text: For purposes of section 3111(d) and 3221(c) of such Code, if the day after the date of the enactment of this Act is not the first day of a calendar quarter, then rules similar to the rules of section 3111(d)(5) and 3221(c)(5) of such Code, respectively, shall apply with respect to the last calendar quarter beginning before such day.

paragraph.text: Except as provided in paragraph (2), the amendments made by this subsection shall apply to wages paid after the date of the enactment of this Act.
The amendments made by subsection (c) shall apply to compensation paid after the date of the enactment of this Act.
